location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 12 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bombay Government that Captain Martin, of the Bengal Establishment, has reported that the tomb of Claudius James Rich and John Taylor at Shiraz has been destroyed. It explains why the Resident considers that this must have been done either under the orders of, or the knowledge of, the Government of Fars. It notes that the matter has been reported to Major George Willock.
